website_summaries.verdict: Perfect way to make airplanes more comfortable – even if you don't suffer from leg pain.
pros: Simple – just hang from tray table and put your foot in the sling
Won't cause you to exceed carry-on limits
Won't annoy the person sitting in front of you
Will give you extra under-seat room
cons: The happiest owners are on the shorter side

customer_reviews.title: good for shorties
customer_reviews.text: This saved me on my first international flight (10+ hrs). It was nice to be able to put my feet up, turn my legs to the side and have them supported, or just have one foot in, whatever. I tried this out after a few hours and slooooowly put my feet into it so I didn't bother the person sitting in front of me, since the straps will pull the seat ahead of you, back. I am 5'3 and think it worked perfectly for my height but not sure how it would do for anyone taller. My traveling companion is 5'10 and she didn't think it was very comfortable/useful.
customer_reviews.author: heliumdawn

customer_reviews.title: Loved this thing but could use a little improvement
customer_reviews.text: Loved this thing but could use a little improvement. I just used this on a trip to Singapore. It worked wonders and it made a difference on a couple of 14-17 hour flights! I gave it one less star because it kept my feet either one on top of another or close together, which is ok for a short time, but the misalignment becomes uncomfortable after such long flights. I will definitely use it again but plan to buy another one so each foot can have its own sling. Great for legs to rest on though (like what is pictured above)
customer_reviews.author: B Forney

customer_reviews.title: Immediate relief for my feet.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but i finally used it on a flight and it made things alot more comfortable. Im 5'6 and was sitting in an 'extra leg room' row and my feet were just hurting. Afraid to disturb the person in front me, set it up on the tray table while being considerate and had no problems. Put the band behind my calf muscles and my feet felt so much better. I would recommend setting up before take off so you can adjust for your size. Made things so much more comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia V

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. I sit most of the day and my feet and ankles always swell. This has done a great job at alleviating the swelling.
customer_reviews.author: KandyKoated

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have Travel Gadget with an Extremely Small Footprint...
customer_reviews.text: Nice & compact. Functional and effective! Will be useful on long international flights, but short domestic flights, with anything under seat makes it difficult to use and get must use out of it. I tried using it on a flight from Boston to Houston with all 3 seats filled and I couldn’t make it work due to lack of space. But international flights have more space and I believe it was would function as expected or perhaps even better! I did use it in the car and it worked like a charm and in the hotel room! So I am definitely a fan and even purchased one for my mother who also suffers from leg swelling. Defiant recommend! Who knew???
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D

customer_reviews.title: Can’t use it on a plane
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use during my long flights overseas because my legs get sore and tired without a place to rest my feet comfortably. Unfortunately, it’s not compatible with most airline seats and other travelers seem bothered by it more than anything. I could find nothing to attach it to, so it has yet to be used 7 months and six flights later.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great product for smaller travelers!
customer_reviews.text: This makes traveling so much more comfortable. I highly recommend it for anyone under 6ft tall. I do realize that this product may not work if the tray table comes undone easily, like if it has a clip function instead of a rotating fastener. This also doesn't have any cushioning, which might be nice if you would be willing to carry the extra material. I like the size of this one, as it is very small and I don't notice the addition to my bag. The triangle shaped support of this foot rest is also perfect, as it distributes the weight of your feel well and does not slip around.
customer_reviews.author: Genna T.

customer_reviews.title: FORGET ABOUT IT
customer_reviews.text: Considering the shrinking space between rows of seats in airplanes---there is NOT ENOUGH ROOM to use this gizmo unless you are traveling first class, in which case you wouldn't need it. Don't waste your $$$.
customer_reviews.author: AKA

customer_reviews.title: First 3 flights (jet blue & a smaller airlines) it was great, on the fourth flight it broke the tray ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this on 4 flights during a trip. First 3 flights (jet blue & a smaller airlines) it was great, on the fourth flight it broke the tray table as soon as I tried it and I had to hold the tray closed for the whole flight!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a transatlantic flight, having suffered through a couple of those in the past. I deducted one star because I was not able to shorten the straps enough to use it with my legs stretched out, but even just putting my feet in the hammock as it hung from my tray table reduced the pressure on my hips and thighs. I was also able to bend my legs to one side, and sort of simulate sleeping on my side. Nothing short of First/Business class is really comfortable, but this made Economy at least tolerable. I also used it during the day on the return flight.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on United Boeing flight, or on the Italia trains in Italy. Had to return. I am 5’6 167 lbs. I really wanted this to work as I have bilateral leg edema. I did travel economy on United.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: These did not work on an airplane... ...
customer_reviews.text: These did not work on an airplane.... thanks to the airlines cramped economy seating there just wasn't enough room...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Functional comfort for long flight!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 16 hour international flight where I was in coach at the back of the plane. It worked really well to take some of the pressure of my lower back by being able to rest my feet somewhere. I was able to either bend my legs at the knee and rest my feet in the foot rest or I could slide my legs all the way through and rest my lower calfs on it. It worked great for me, but I'm only 5'2". I can't see how this would work well for someone much taller than me though-- there wouldn't be room for much longer legs to go under the seat I wouldn't think.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for long coach flights!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is a game changer for long flights in coach! This allowed me to keep my feet off the ground, taking the compression and pressure of my thighs, preventing my ankles and feet from swelling like they have in the past. The picture shows the calf part of the leg resting in it, I had the bottom of my socked feet resting in it. I am 5’4”. On one of my 8 hour flights I had a wondow and the aisle seat next to it to myself. I was able to kind of curl up, lay down and extend my legs off the seat onto this foot rest.
customer_reviews.author: Lanie

customer_reviews.title: International Flight Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Great if you’re short! I fly international a lot and when I don’t get to sit in business class this foot rest is a real life saver! When I have to sit bulk head I just use two 5lb Command hooks to hold it up. Great quality, folds up really small, and comes with a handy little bag for storing. Highly recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: CeSa

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work out for me.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work out for me. Was challenging to place on seat in front of me and when I did and placed my feet on it, the weight of them adjusted the strap and enlongated it and my feet were touching the floor instead of being supported by the strap. I gave up. Good idea though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Solis

customer_reviews.title: Does work.
customer_reviews.text: This product really does work. I was able to place it around the bottom of the tray and "hang" my feet thereby giving some support to them. Yes, it does feel like a hammock for feet, and they will shift to the center of the foot rest, but it does do what it says it will do. I used it off/on from my round trip to Melbourne Australia from Atlanta Ga. flying two airlines.
customer_reviews.author: verified purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are sitting in the exit row or have an exorbitant amount of space (which is the case in about .01% of flights nowadays), it is impossible that this device would be comfortable to set-up and use. It bothered me more than helped me. Going into the donation pile.
customer_reviews.author: BM99

customer_reviews.title: Flying internationally was never easier!
customer_reviews.text: If you can only afford economy like me and most of the world out there than this is for you! My 20 hr flight was much easier with this adjustable foot rest and the Trtl Neck Pillow. You can adjust the foot rest to many different heights which you really need to do on a long haul flight . It makes snoozing on the flight so much more comfortable when your feet have some support
customer_reviews.author: TechGeek

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack/travel with
customer_reviews.text: SImple and effective! Easy to pack/travel with. Just don't expect some luxury experience, its still just a rudimentary swing mean to elevate legs to ease discomfort dor long periods of sitting, not eliminate it.
customer_reviews.author: MeMyselfandRi

customer_reviews.title: Not great for limited legroom flights
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it would work beautifully if you have upgraded seats, with more legroom. Unfortunately I was in regular seats on an overseas flight, and had limited legroom. On top of that, there was a utility box of some sort under the seat in front of me, so I had limited space, and could not extend my feet under the seat, making this product virtually useless. I tried but it just wasn't comfortable. I used my blow up foot cushion instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten M

customer_reviews.title: Might work on some airlines....but not with small seat spaces now
customer_reviews.text: Ok but didn’t work on most airlines very well due to limited space, might work in premium seats but not in coach. I used them a bit on Air France but angle not really very comfortable. More like a foot rest with Delta seats....doesn’t really work as pictured. KLM. kind of worked but gets in the way if you are getting in or out or your seatmate is. Would have returned but past time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: This little foot rest was a game changer for our International flights! Sitting so long on a plane can cause a lot of discomfort in the legs but this adjustable foot rest was a remedy to that! No leg cramps or pain. It was easy to stretch your legs out or put your feet in and bend at the knees. The option of changing leg position and not having them down on the floor was brilliant! We highly recommend this for long travel trips!!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: great for a long flight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 14 hour flight and it made the hours pass so much more pleasantly. I am petite and there are times when my feet don't hit the floor of the plane very comfortably. Pull your tray table down, loop the straps over it and then close the table back up. It gives good support and takes up so little room in your carry on. I am not sure it would benefit a tall person though as someone with long legs would not be able to stretch them out full length but I often just sat with my feet on the sling with my legs bent and that was great also.
customer_reviews.author: Redwoods Reader

customer_reviews.title: Broke within first second of use
customer_reviews.text: This gadget broke one second after first use which means, it never worked. Return window closed a couple days ago while I was on vacation which indicates, they know the product is junk and they know it will break. Don’t bother-junk.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carey

customer_reviews.title: If you are always trying to get your legs and feet comfortable on a flight...this works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on my long flights to the East Coast. I like to be able to put my feet up and feel awkward trying to get comfortable in such a tight space. You drape it over the tray table, adjust the height, and stick your feet on it. It has made a huge difference in my comfort level and has helped my legs and back. It's easy to pack and carry. It's one of those simple purchases that makes flying so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Coit

customer_reviews.title: Works, but after a while, it begins to feel uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5 ft tall so any flight over an hour starts to become uncomfortable for me. Initially, when i start using the foot rest, it feels great, but after some time, the fact that your feet is squish together starts to feel uncomfortable. So, I'm not sure what's worst, the feet being squish together or the lack of blood flow to my calves. I just wish the foot rest had a firm base that can be collapse when not using, like a wooden swing so the feet aren't push together. This is probably okay on a 5-hour flight or less, but definitely will need something better for long international flights.
customer_reviews.author: HelenW

customer_reviews.title: Negative reviews?
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved my life on a 15 hour plane trip in Economy I might add. I also used it in the car in the 3 hour car ride. Love it!! In reading the negative reviews, I think those people weren’t using it right. It is fully adjustable. And so nce you can’t rest your calves on it with that small space in Economy, you just put your feet on it. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: DolfinDi

customer_reviews.title: A must for every flight now.
customer_reviews.text: This was excellent for long flights. On an uncomfortable flight there's not too much you can do to make it comfortable, but this certainly helps! I'm 5'2'', so not sure if there is enough room for this to be useful for taller people, but for us shorties with feet that don't fully touch the ground, this is a great solution to comfort on any flight!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Bailey

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER!
customer_reviews.text: Saved my life on a flight to Australia/ New Zealand! I am 4'10" and my feet ALWAYS swell on flights because they do not touch the floor. I bought this in anticipation of the longest flight of my life from NC to Australia and back from New Zealand. It made a world of difference. Still an uncomfortable flight but this helped OH SO much! You have to play arund with the straps for the proper length and I did not notice it affecting the person in front of me at all. I'll never travel without it!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Stahli

customer_reviews.title: Relieves back pressure during long flights
customer_reviews.text: Recently went on a trip to Greece and normally long flights are an agony to me. This made such a difference it was unbelievable. At the end of the flight I had no backache or leg ache. I used it pretty much the entire flight. I have never been able to sleep on flights either and something about being able to get my feet up made it easier. I LOVE this product! I was traveling with 5 other women and they all said they were going to get one too. My husband is traveling to Canada next week and is taking it with him because I raved about it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha LeVasseur

customer_reviews.title: Good if you are in a better class
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 5 stars as the quality is good and it does what it says it does. But, don't buy if you are flying in economy. This is good if you are flying in economy plus or higher, as planes now have such limited space you can't even set it up. This issue is the plane's fault, and not the producer or vendor's fault at all. I flew internationally in economy basic and you can barely fit a purse under the seats now. Great if you are planning a trip with a plane that has adequate foot space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’6” and often feel uncomfortable on long flights because of my preference to have my feet up. This worked great for me even with the smaller amount of leg room on flights now a days! Even when the person in front of me reclined their seat, it still allowed for my feet to be elevated. My only wish would be for the strap to be a little short to raise my feet a little higher. Considered putting a knot in it to shorten the strap. Maybe I’ll try that on my next trip!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cramped!
customer_reviews.text: While I had high hopes for this product, when you put two feet into the sling they slide together in a very uncomfortable way. This product needs to be redesigned so that the feet can be separated & spread apart. Unfortunately, I bought this well before my long overseas flight and cannot return. Buyer beware. Check this out before you go overseas or suffer through 12 hours of discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: TPF

customer_reviews.title: I've used it 5 times already!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, sturdy, folds away easy for storing. Along with my compression socks, this device prevented my legs from swelling after a 15 hour flight to Australia. It also allowed me to stretch out a bit and sleep. I've already recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Short Folks on any flight!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for short folks on international flights!! I bought one for myself and my daughter for our latest flight to France. We used it on every flight. Fits on the tray table and soooo easy to transport. Very durable and allowed my daughter and I to sit / sleep comfortably for 8 hours. I wish I had bought this sooner to avoid the leg and knee aches I have endured on previous flights.
customer_reviews.author: Annie H

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but doesn't work in modern world with short legroom
customer_reviews.text: Ideally, you rest your calf on this. However, with most airlines nowadays having such short space between the seat in front of you and your seat (even though I had more legroom in Deluxe economy), this thing basically is up at your knees and not at the calf. Absolutely useless. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: M.A Veth

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure I’d like this but once I tried I do like it. The only reason I didn’t give five stars in sturdiness, is because it does pull on the seat I front slightly when you move around. My legs felt great. I’m 5’5 and my feet touch the floor but not comfortable. My feet felt slightly squished together. I might buy another one just to try to separate my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Works well as expected, sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used on several long haul flights (12 hr+) and it does make a difference. In truth I sometimes took my legs out so I can fully stretch straight to change up position but the ability to rest my feet in this hammock helped release tension in my lower back and also let me quite easily curl up on my side to rest if I wanted to. Material is sturdy and the black is very discreet. Came with a travel bag (which I lost) that's very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Tsack2006

customer_reviews.title: Horrid and useless
customer_reviews.text: This product was a waste of money. It is very poorly designed and useless.
customer_reviews.author: RachelF

customer_reviews.title: Even makes flying coach comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a plane trip across the ocean (in coach) for me and my mother. My mother thought it was a silly purchase until we both tried it and it made our trip so much more comfortable. Even with limited leg room we were both able to get decent sleep because we could curl up into a fetal position and sleep with our feet off the floor. If you’re have trouble getting comfy on a long plane ride I recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Fogg

customer_reviews.title: Nice footrest for short legs
customer_reviews.text: Nice footrest if you've got fairly short legs. I was concerned about it bothering the passenger in front of me - most flyers have experienced the annoyance of someone jolting seat from behind, but the person in front of me said that she didn't notice it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz D.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Got this and a blow up type rest for my wife to use on our long flight. She used the blow up one on first flight and it leaked air and wasn’t too comfortable. On way back home she used the sling and said it was great. She said it was sturdy, took up less space under the seat, and she could adjust her legs more easily. It takes up a lot less space than the blow up type of rest so you can save space on your carryon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Offers support, as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This product supports your legs/feet while sitting down. Used this during a 14-hour flight. It’s adjustable and it was nice to be support at multiple levels. To work on a plane, this product needs to be mounted on the seat in front of you. If you move your feet, the pressure applied to this product will most likely be felt by the person in the seat in front of you. Be nice and try not to move too much. The product itself is sturdy and constructed well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Boyfriday

customer_reviews.title: we just made 6 flights around the globe and she absolutely loved this weird device
customer_reviews.text: My wife is short and her legs just barely hit the deck when she is in an airplane seat. I bought this on a "lark" and it was only 10 bucks or so. Well..we just made 6 flights around the globe and she absolutely loved this weird device. I honestly give it a solid 5 stars. It really is ideal for a short legged person to be more comfortable on a flight.... weird but great!
customer_reviews.author: Sreve Larson

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but MUCH better
customer_reviews.text: This makes my airplane experience MUCH better. It isn’t perfect; the strap is adjustable, but it can take some trial and error to find the best length. Also, because it has no rigidity, your feet will tend to crowd together in the center of the footpad, which can be awkward for your knees. That said, this is the first time I’ve flown and not left the plane with a crippling back ache because my feet didn’t comfortably rest on the floor. This is a cheapie buy, so if you’re a shrimp like me, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: I put it out as far as it would go and it kept sliding up and hitting me at the back of the knee. I could rest my feet on it but that's about it. My husband and I were not able to really use them on our long trip to Europe.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina Cusick

customer_reviews.title: Good footrest for long travels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and 1 of another brand. This one is good quality but the other one is better. I wanted 2, 1 for mysel and 1 for my husband, but the other company had a restriction of only being able to purchase 1 item. The only real difference if the size for the leg room. This one is smaller and not as nice looking. But it does work good and. Would recommend it for the price and added comfort.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rubio

customer_reviews.title: Too short to put feet on floor
customer_reviews.text: Doing a lot of plane travel, this is the best purchase I have made. There is no movement involving the seat back in front of you; they cause no harm to the tray; a short person can finally sit comfortably . I can't think of anything negative about this footrest.
customer_reviews.author: Skier

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn't work. Unless you are very short or a child.
customer_reviews.author: Heythere!

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for a head pillow
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. There is no longer any space between your seat and the person in front of you, so it’s impossible to even use this product unless you are in premium or first class. And if you’re up there, you don’t need this.
customer_reviews.author: Beeps

customer_reviews.title: Meh.. Just ok. It's a basic leg sling.
customer_reviews.text: As far as for a plane.. It's just ok. Didn't really make a difference with the plane I was on. I could see it working for other applications. It is what it is. It's a sling. So if you have the room to stretch your legs out it would work good, it's just not gonna magically give you more room 😏
customer_reviews.author: Kit7378

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the durability but I used it on two 11 hour flights plus two shorter flights and it's holding up fine. I do get a tad uncomfortable over long periods of time but less so than when my feet are on the ground. I noticed less ankle swelling as well, something I'm prone to. I intend to keep using it on future flights. Love how small it packs down as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: A must for a short person, long flight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife. She is short and hated having the added pressure on her legs from dangling feet on long flights. She hooks this over the fold-down tray then closes the tray. She has now used this for about 24 hours of flight time and loves it. Her legs are much more comfortable. She didn’t use it for one flight and definitely noticed more numbing in her legs.
customer_reviews.author: A. McGathey

customer_reviews.title: Cant's use on the airplane
customer_reviews.text: Because i can't afford first class, this is not the best use for economy class. The straps are too long and it just falls to the floor. Returned after it failed me for my first flight. Just put your feet on your handbag :)
customer_reviews.author: Nadiah

customer_reviews.title: Improves your plane trip tenfold
customer_reviews.text: This gadget helps me be so much more comfortable on the plane. I also bought one for a friend who travel a lot and she slept the entire plane trip when using the foot hammock, which she is not usually able do. Both of us are short - under 5'4''. The design is well thought out. Adjustable and provides good support. I researched several similar items and I think this design is superior.
customer_reviews.author: think

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for road warriors
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used it on a long flight and it definitely helped with comfort and sleep. I really liked how adjustable it is. I had it lower for sitting, and higher for turned on my side (as much as you can in coach) to sleep. Worked with the tray up or down with no issues. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Harris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work multiple airlines
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a flight to Australia, but couldn't get it to work on that flight or any of my connections. Tried it on Delta, Virgin, Jetstar, and Quantas planes. It always slips awkwardly down the tray table supports and is useless if the person in front of you leans back. Waste of money - wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Teacup Squid

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase EVER for long flights
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once so I really can't tell about the durability, but I have no reason to believe it won't last for years. I used it a few weeks ago for travel - 4 flights for a total of about 46 hours. I don't know how I did this travel without it. Doing another round trip of 14 hours next week and am really looking forward to having it with me. It makes the trip so much more comfortable!!
customer_reviews.author: TPB A.

customer_reviews.title: It does help
customer_reviews.text: Taking long flights is always very tiring, and swollen feet is so uncomfortable. This foot rest does help a lot. It's easy to use and to store away. Since it's very light, the material is not very sturdy, my feet would slip around. However, it's still better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMocha

customer_reviews.title: YAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I slept all the way to Germany! I have crummy knees and my circulation is bothered my dangling my legs for so long. This is something I will never travel without on long flights. My buddy was miserably sore in her back and knee without this and so I'm going to buy one for her too!
customer_reviews.author: Texas mama

customer_reviews.title: Best travel purchase EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this thing on NINE overseas flights throughout the last month. Oh.MY.GOD how did I ever fly without it?! Seriously, being able to put my feet up on long flights was sooooo amazing. Buy this thing now if you want to elevate your travel experience without paying for business class.
customer_reviews.author: Linz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flights
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for a 5' 3" woman. Love how easy it is to pack in cary on bags. Much easier than taking a foot rest pillow! Also, because it doesn't touch the ground I don't worry about it getting dirty from the nasty floors on these domestic flights.
customer_reviews.author: Earl E. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory, NOT in practice
customer_reviews.text: This looks great–in theory. In actual practice, it was hard to position it properly. I'm short so it never worked as it should have. It was more of a hassle than a help on a long, international flight. I did not use it at all on my return flight. Wasted money...
customer_reviews.author: G. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$
customer_reviews.text: Your legs do not sit in it properly and the only place to fasten it is to the tray table which makes for an awkward position. Waste of $$
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Choi

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for long flightd
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept! Wish the strap was longer. It worked great when the plane tray was in the down position, but not as comfy when the tray was up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W.

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I need for a long (or short) flight!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on an 8-hour international flight last week and it made all the difference to my comfort level. I'm 5' tall and airline seats are definitely not made for short legs. This footrest fit easily over the tray table with no obstruction to the functionality of the tray table. I love that it is adjustable and easy to use. I will never fly without my Andyer Foot Rest!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for my long 9 hour plane trip
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for my long 9 hour plane trip. I was seated in economy so not a lot of stretching out room, but this gave me the ability to at least raise my legs up and relax back. Well worth it and folds up small so easy to carry! Highly highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Lackey

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me !!
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as described. Maybe my seats were to close together, but once the person in front of me pushed their back down it was just to close to use and didn't hold the legs or feet at all. Certainly wont hold the feet with the tray down since your knees would hit on the tray !!
customer_reviews.author: ken wing

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for short people - makes a flight almost comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My wife is 4 feet 10 inches and normally would not reach the floor in most airplanes. This provided a "hammock" for her feet and she was much, much more comfortable that she would have been without it - especially on our 15+ hour flights. She liked it so much that we bought (another) one for our daughter and just (highly) recommended it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Shwimer

customer_reviews.title: Great for lower back pain on long flights!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for international travel and used it on a 14 hour flight and it definitely worked. It relieves tension on my lower back and helped when I got restless and wanted my feet to be off the floor. I definitely recommend for anyone who loves to travel but has lower back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Nor what I’d hoped
customer_reviews.text: First I had knee replacement surgery a year ago and can’t bend my leg all the way. That made trying to get my leg into the holster almost impossible. Sorry but it was pretty useless and I can’t recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: B C Allred

customer_reviews.title: Just do it.
customer_reviews.text: Flying to Europe for the first time and this made allll the difference! I also used it on the plane, bus and train. I'm 5'4", so my feet touch the ground, but the seat puts pressure on the backs of my legs. I would absolutely recommend this :)
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My son always complains that his back hurts due to his feet not being supported. He LOVES this hammock and it doesn’t take up any room in the back
customer_reviews.author: LStrong

customer_reviews.title: It’s not strong at all to hold ur feet or ur legs
customer_reviews.text: It don’t work at all what a waste of money don’t wasyur money
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think this product would be useful but it sure proved me wrong
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this product would be useful but it sure proved me wrong. I flew a 13 hour fight from the US to Asia. Just hang it using the tray table on the plane and your set. Made my trip a bit more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Nino

customer_reviews.title: Great for short people!
customer_reviews.text: I love this contraption! I use it whenever I travel on a plane. It helps my feet with swelling and I’m more comfortable, as it keeps my body aligned. I sleep way better on long flights now. It’s also really compact so I never mind carrying it.
customer_reviews.author: katrina bar

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, helps a lot on the plane
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this footrest before going on to 10-hours flight overseas and then back, and it did nicely what I expected it to do. It greatly increased options to place the feet and support them, removing the need to keep them static on the floor whenever I sit. Worth every dollar spent. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Leo B.

customer_reviews.title: Short People Only
customer_reviews.text: Product is not useful for anyone who's even medium height. Perfect for kids or anyone shorter than 4'11". At 5'8", economy seats are so small, so miserably small, that it is totally uncomfortable to use this product. It's worthless for anyone higher than Economy, because those seats typically have better foot rests already.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on airplanes.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to try on two different airlines, and it just didn't work. There is not enough space in front of the seat, even for a short person.
customer_reviews.author: Karenf

customer_reviews.title: Cool product didn’t help in economy but I should be ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool product didn’t help in economy but I should be perfect for business or premium economy where you have a little more leg room
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: no room for set it up
customer_reviews.text: it can't even be used with in coach seats, not enough room
customer_reviews.author: Sally P.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: My 12 hour flight is next week and I will use it then. For now I’m using it while watching tv to get use to it and it’s actually pretty comfortable. I noticed less stress on my lower back! I’ll come back and leave an update after my trip.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great for flights
customer_reviews.text: I have short legs and I can never get comfortable on a plane. These are great for me and I can rest more comfortably. The only problem is that I wish I can make them even shorter, they are adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this product, especially for long flights. It isn't as easy to use with a tray table as was described...also, my legs were very hard to adjust/move while in the sling. Doubt if I will use it again.
customer_reviews.author: KDunn

customer_reviews.title: OMG LOVE - if you like to put your feet up, spend the $12!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS INVENTION! I am 5'8" girl, but when I sit on planes i like to put my feet up. If no one is in front of me, I will put my feet on the arm rest (rude!) or crunch myself down and put my knees on the seat in front of me. But this is awesome. Really light and packable, doesn't bother the person in front of you (just be considerate), and I shortened it all the way. This, plus my inflatable neck pillow, and I was able to "curl" up and sleep on an overnight flight for the first time maybe ever!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Devine

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver...don't think it would help most men on flights
customer_reviews.text: From Alaska to India and back. I am 5'8" and it still helped alot yo be able to put my feet up and switch positions during my flight. This is a lifesaver!!! They need to make a few little pillows to sell with it, like one for between your knees and the seat tray if u are taller. Works with the food tray up or down.
customer_reviews.author: C. Eyrewire

customer_reviews.title: She says it's easy to use and one of the flight attendants on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this foot rest sling for my mom. And... she loves it! It does the job and it helps her knee when she travels. She says it's easy to use and one of the flight attendants on her flight was interested and asked about it. Good travel accessory find at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonelle C.

customer_reviews.title: strap attached to 2 points on the sling
customer_reviews.text: The sling part stays flat, which was a worry since this didn't have any ribs to keep the sling flat otherwise. One thing though: for me, one foot always ended up on top of the other. There was no comfortable way to keep the feet next to each other. I think the best solution would be to get 2 of them just so your feet can be kept apart. But other than that, it's a definite step up from keep your feet on the floor or on top of your below-the-seat personal item, especially on long flights
customer_reviews.author: stevie

customer_reviews.title: Great product. No problems with transaction.
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver on a 13 day economy flight. A friend of mine told me about this product 2 days before my departure. I ordered it next day. Got it on time. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Soha Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: Helpul
customer_reviews.text: This did help to relieve having your feet on the floor. The way it hangs when you put your feet in, puts your feet really close together. It would be nice to have more room to keep feet apart.
customer_reviews.author: cjamio

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this on a 9.5 hour flight and it was pointless. I shortened the straps to hold my legs off of the airplane floor, but the plastic piece holding it in place shifts very easily as soon as you put your legs in the sling....it cannot hold any weight at all. I ended up putting my feet on my backpack under the seat in front of me instead.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Allen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t take up much room in your carryon.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this gadget for a long plane trip (5 1/2 hours) because I have a bad leg. It was easy to setup over the fold down tray and didn’t get in the way. Made the long trip more comfortable and helped my leg and sore feet relax during the flight. It is easy to store in your carry on bag. Doesn’t take up a lot of room. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for budget airlines
customer_reviews.text: Budget airlines have shorter seats causing leg discomfort. Having these helped with that problem.
customer_reviews.author: ponderic sim

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for coach seating
customer_reviews.text: Only good for Economy Plus - longer seating - or it doesn't work well. Too cumbersome to get feet into or out of without a lot of trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ross

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works
customer_reviews.text: Easy and convenient, but most importantly it works! Yes, I used it for the first time after a foot operation on a 10-hour flight. I had no swelling in my feet or ankles. I was amazed. Plus it is so convenient, it rolls up and fit easily in my back pack.
customer_reviews.author: Dannette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for travel!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this foot hammock! I used it on my last flight and it was fantastic! Really helped my legs from falling asleep. Sturdy, made well and very lightweight and compact. Ordered another one for a traveling companion! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: long hours flight
customer_reviews.text: I used on a long hour flight at least 15 hours, I used only for less than half time during flight but my leg muscle was relaxed and then tight
customer_reviews.author: Rupo

customer_reviews.title: This thing has changed my life
customer_reviews.text: I've tried resting my feet on my backpack and it was never quite right. This little thing is really pretty amazing. I also thought it would look geeky but its barely visible once its set up. Only negative is that when its on, the tray table is hard to close but I was on a 12 hour flight from Japan and it saved my legs. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: C. Grisham

customer_reviews.title: You will get used to putting your feet in sling after a couple of uses...
customer_reviews.text: This works better than anything I have tried while flying. Bought one for my niece who is a flight attendant and she loves it! Helps reduce swelling in your ankles and feet.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Washburn

product_meta.title: Foot Rest, Portable Travel Footrest Flight Carry-On Foot Rest Adjustable Height Foot Rest Travel Accessories Footrests Hammock, Black.

Easy to use-just hanging this traveling footrest to the bracket of the tray table, then put your foot on it.
Best traveling accessories-lightweight and mini carry-on Flight foot rests, easy to carry without increase your bag's burden.

Any time any where-can be use in office, School, bus, train, long-distance airway. With it, you can release your feet, This foot rest makes a wonderful gift for the Travelers in your life. Includes a no-risk, 100% money-back , Try it today and see for yourself!
